intro: Borismene japurensis, commonly known as the Japurá borismene, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has smooth, waxy leaves that help it retain moisture. Its floral structure and growth habits make it an important species for studying plant adaptations in tropical ecosystems.
